marketNews.title: BI Projects Indonesian Economy to Grow +5.3% in 2026
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that they predict Indonesia's economic growth in 2026 will range between +4.7-5.5% YoY, with a tendency to be at the +5.3% YoY level in line with falling interest rates. This projection is higher compared to Bank Indonesia's projection for Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 at the +5.1% YoY level.

When compared with other institutions, Bank Indonesia's projection for 2026 is lower than the government's target in the 2026 State Budget Draft (RAPBN 2026) at the +5.4% YoY level, but higher than the Bloomberg consensus survey in August 2025 at +4.9% YoY and the IMF projection in July 2025 at +4.8% YoY.

In line with this economic growth projection, Perry stated that they expect banking credit growth to be in the range of +9-12% YoY in 2026, higher than the projection of +8-11% YoY this year.

The 2026 economic growth projection is based on monetary and fiscal policy directions:
1. Monetary Policy - Perry mentioned that Bank Indonesia continues to look for room to cut interest rates further given low inflation, a stable rupiah, and the need to boost economic growth. The Bloomberg consensus also expects a BI Rate cut of -25 bps again to the 4.75% level by the end of 2025 and a further cut of -25 bps throughout 2026.
2. Fiscal Policy - Based on the 2026 RAPBN, consumption and investment are expected to be the drivers of economic growth, with consumption projected to grow +5.2% YoY (vs. 2025 APBN outlook: +4.7-5% YoY) and investment expected to grow +5.2% YoY (vs. 2025 APBN outlook: +4.5-4.7% YoY). Priority programs in the 2026 RAPBN focus on supporting purchasing power, which includes the Free Nutritious Meal program, Red and White Village Cooperatives, as well as food and energy security. To support government program financing, Bank Indonesia has signed a new burden sharing agreement with the government, although there are no details yet on how long this scheme will last and how much government bonds will be borne by Bank Indonesia. Meanwhile, investment is expected to be boosted by the presence of Danantara.

To support spending, the 2026 RAPBN targets state revenue to increase by +9.8% YoY, supported by a +13% YoY increase in tax revenue. Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, affirmed that the government will not impose new taxes or raise tax rates in 2026, but rather encourage improvements in taxpayer compliance.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The success of the government in boosting economic growth again has the potential to be a key factor in the significant return of foreign inflow to the IHSG. Since the beginning of this year, the IHSG has recorded a net foreign outflow of ~55 trillion rupiah as of Thursday (4/9).

marketNews.title: Hot News You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
US President, Donald Trump, stated that he will immediately file an appeal to the Supreme Court as early as Wednesday (3/9) local time regarding the reciprocal tariff dispute. Trump's statement came after the US Federal High Court on Friday (29/8) last week ruled that reciprocal tariffs were a violation of Trump's emergency power usage as president. Nevertheless, the US Federal High Court did not annul the implementation of Trump's reciprocal tariffs, where these tariffs will remain in effect until at least October 14, 2025, to give the US government time to file an appeal to the Supreme Court. As context, 6 out of 9 judges at the US Supreme Court are currently appointed by the Republican Party, so Trump still has a chance to maintain his reciprocal tariff policy.
The US labor statistics bureau noted that job vacancies in the US in July 2025 dropped by 176,000 to 7.18 million, marking the lowest level since September 2024 and far below the consensus expectation of 7.4 million. Furthermore, the number of job vacancies in June 2025 was revised down by 80,000 compared to previous estimates to 7.36 million. The US labor statistics bureau also revised up the number of people laid off in June 2025 by 192,000 compared to previous estimates to ~1.8 million.
A Bloomberg survey estimates that palm oil stocks in Malaysia rose by +2.8% MoM in August 2025 to 2.17 million tons, marking the highest level since December 2023, continuing the upward monthly trend for the last 6 months. Meanwhile, crude palm oil production in Malaysia in August 2025 is estimated to have increased by +2.2% MoM to 1.85 million tons, marking the highest level in the last 1 year, while exports are expected to surge by +11% MoM to 1.45 million tons. The increase in palm oil supply in Malaysia could weigh down the benchmark CPO futures price, especially during the current high production cycle which usually peaks in October.
Kompas reported that the Attorney General's Office on Thursday (4/9) named the former Minister of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology, Nadiem Makarim, a suspect in an alleged corruption case involving the procurement of Chromebook-based laptops. The Head of the Legal Information Center of the Attorney General's Office, Anang Supriatna, said that Nadiem was named a suspect after they examined approximately 120 witnesses and 4 experts in this case.

tickerNews.title: OASA: Maharaksa Biru Energi Plans Private Placement for Waste Processing Project
tickerNews.content: OASA: Maharaksa Biru Energi plans to conduct a private placement of approximately ~634.7 million (10%) shares, with the execution price and prospective investors yet to be announced. Proceeds from this corporate action are intended for business development, and this plan will be discussed in an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on September 8, 2025. OASA stated that a portion of the private placement proceeds will be allocated for the development of a waste-to-energy power plant project in South Tangerang, which will be carried out by a joint venture between the company's business entity and China Tianying Inc. OASA's business entity will hold a 76% stake in the joint venture. OASA explained that this project has a capacity of 19.6 MW with an investment value of 2.65 trillion rupiah, where the electricity generated will be sold to PLN through a cooperation agreement with a term of 27 years.

tickerNews.title: ARCI Targets 10x Net Profit Growth to Around USD 100 Million in 2025
tickerNews.content: ARCI: Archi Indonesia President Director, Rudy Suhendra, stated that the company potentially records a tenfold increase in net profit to around 100 million US dollars in 2025 following the increase in gold prices and sales volume. Rudy added that the prospect of this significant net profit increase opens room for the company to distribute dividends to shareholders, where ARCI targets being able to distribute dividends from 2026 performance. Rudy explained that ARCI can at least boost gold production and/or sales volume by around +25% YoY by the end of 2025. During 1H25, ARCI recorded an increase in gold sales volume by +5% YoY to 49,200 troy ounces, with the average selling price rising +41% YoY to 3,128 US dollars per troy ounce.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Denies Synergy with CBRE through Hafar Group Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea in a clarification to the IDX denied the news that the company through its subsidiary, the Hafar group, would synergize with Cakra Buana Resources Energi ($CBRE). Previously, Emitennews reported that the synergy between CBRE and the Hafar Offshore business group would strengthen along with CBRE's plan to acquire a pipe-laying & lifting vessel.

tickerNews.title: BRPT Clarifies No Intention to Acquire BUVA
tickerNews.content: BRPT: Barito Pacific in a clarification through a press release denied the news that Prajogo Pangestu and/or companies under his control would acquire Bukit Uluwatu Villa ($BUVA). BRPT explained that currently the company is not in discussions to acquire BUVA and urges the public to be careful in interpreting baseless rumors that do not originate from official sources.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Announces New Share Buyback Program Totalling IDR 1.2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional announced a plan to buy back shares up to 407 million (1.62%) shares with a fund allocation up to 815 billion rupiah in the period of September 8, 2025-December 8, 2025. This buyback is a continuation of the previously announced buyback for the period of March 26-June 25, 2025, following the relaxation of buyback rules provided by OJK to support capital market stability. Besides this buyback, MEDC is also in a buyback period for up to 240 million (0.95%) shares with a fund allocation of up to 408 billion rupiah for the period of June 4, 2025-June 3, 2026, where this plan was approved at the RUPSLB in June 2025. Both corporate actions imply a maximum share buyback fund allocation for MEDC reaching ~1.2 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 200 Billion
tickerNews.content: TOWR: Sarana Menara Nusantara plans to conduct a share buyback up to 296 million (~0.5%) shares with a fund allocation up to 200 billion rupiah in the period of September 4-December 3, 2025. This plan does not require RUPS approval, following the relaxation provided by OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Commissioner Purchased Shares Worth ~IDR 1.9 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN) Commissioner, Alexander Ramlie, purchased approximately 230 million AMMN shares with an average price of 8,070 rupiah per share on August 28-September 1, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.9 trillion rupiah and was intended for the purpose of restructuring share collateral. Following this transaction, Alexander Ramlie's ownership in AMMN increased from 0.145% to 0.462%. Previously, Alexander Ramlie sold ~283 million AMMN shares with a transaction value reaching ~2.3 trillion rupiah on August 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BNBR Subsidiary Plans Acquisition of 90% of Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways
tickerNews.content: Bakrie & Brothers ($BNBR) through its subsidiary, PT Bakrie Toll Indonesia, plans to acquire 90% of the shares of PT Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways worth a total of 3.6 trillion rupiah from PT Waskita Toll Road and PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur. The acquisition plan covers 90% of the shares worth 1 trillion rupiah and the receivables of PT Waskita Toll Road and PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur to PT Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways worth 2.6 trillion rupiah. In connection with this transaction, PT Bakrie Toll Indonesia will sign a loan facility agreement worth ~5.1 trillion rupiah or equivalent to 312 million US dollars with ADH Jackpot SPV Limited, a subsidiary of Alpha Dhabi Holding PJSC (ADX: ALPHADHABI). The loan has an interest rate of up to 20% per year, with a tenor of 5 years and extendable by 2 years. The loan will be used by PT Bakrie Toll Indonesia to provide bridging loans, convertible shareholder loans, and operational shareholder loans to PT Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways.
